title.value: Conservative objective models are a special kind of contrastive divergence-based energy model
title.justification: This is the title of the paper from the provided document.
title.quote: Conservative objective models are a special kind of contrastive divergence-based energy model

extractions.description: The paper theoretically shows that conservative objective models (COMs) for offline model-based optimization (MBO) are a specific type of contrastive divergence-based energy model. The authors propose improvements to these models by introducing a Langevin MCMC sampler and decoupling the modeling of unconditional and conditional probabilities. They demonstrate their theoretical findings and proposed methods on a toy dataset.

type.justification: The paper is focused on providing a theoretical analysis of conservative objective models (COMs) and how they relate to contrastive divergence-based energy models. It also proposes theoretical improvements to these models.
type.quote: In this work we theoretically show that conservative objective models (COMs) for offline model-based optimisation (MBO) are a special kind of contrastive divergence-based energy model.

name.justification: The paper is focused on model-based optimization (MBO) and energy-based models (EBMs), which are sub-fields within Machine Learning.
name.quote: Lastly, we show that better samples can be obtained if the model is decoupled so that the unconditional and conditional probabilities are modelled separately.

name.justification: The paper is dedicated to model-based optimization, particularly focusing on conservative objective models (COMs) for offline MBO.
name.quote: In this work we theoretically show that conservative objective models (COMs) for offline model-based optimisation (MBO) are a special kind of contrastive divergence-based energy model.

name.justification: The paper discusses energy-based models (EBMs) in detail and shows that COMs fall into this category.
name.quote: We theoretically show that conservative objective models (COMs) are a special kind of contrastive divergence-based energy model.

name.justification: The paper examines conservative objective models (COMs) and proposes theoretical and empirical improvements to them.
name.quote: We theoretically show that conservative objective models (COMs) are extremely similar to an energy-based model (EBM) that is trained via contrastive divergence.

is_contributed.justification: The model is not newly introduced in this paper but rather analyzed and improved upon.
is_contributed.quote: Conservative objective models (COMs) are a recently proposed method (Trabucco et al., 2021) for MBO.

is_executed.justification: The model is executed to demonstrate its theoretical improvements on a toy dataset.
is_executed.quote: We illustrate the effect of α on a toy spiral dataset in Section 3 as well as visualise generated samples between the both COMs variants.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the proposed improvements to COMs against the original model formulation.
is_compared.quote: We train each of the three variants of COMs, and their results are shown in Figures 2, 3, and 4, respectively.

referenced_paper_title.value: Conservative objective models for effective offline model-based optimization

name.justification: The paper proposes a stochastic variant of COMs that uses Langevin MCMC to properly sample from the distribution.
name.quote: Stochastic COMs have the special property that the probability of sampling an input is proportional to its predicted reward.

is_contributed.justification: The model is a proposed improvement and contribution to the existing COMs framework.
is_contributed.quote: Stochastic COMs are a special probabilistic model proposed in this paper.

name.justification: The paper proposes a decoupled variant of COMs to improve the sampling quality by using separate models for unconditional and conditional probabilities.
name.quote: To alleviate this, we propose decoupled COMs, where a separate classifier is trained and its gradients are used at sampling time.

name.justification: The toy dataset used in the experiments is a 2D spiral dataset with a reward function.

name.justification: NumPy is used for generating a geometric sequence for the variance schedule in Langevin MCMC.
name.quote: This can be generated easily in Numpy via numpy.geomspace(a=0.02, b=0.001, n).
